accountDisabled: Account has been disabled. Please contact an administrator if you believe this is a mistake
incorrectPassword: Wrong password. Try again or reset your password. You may also have created your account with a different method
accountExists: Email already has an account. Please sign in or use a different email
passwordHelpMessage: Enter your current password before updating your account

signOutError: Error occurred with sign out. Please try again
name: Name
noName: Please add a name to your account
wrongMethod: Account created with different sign in method. Please sign in with one of the following:
tryAgain: Error occurred. Please try to sign in with a different method.
popUpsBlocked: Sign in pop up blocked. Enable pop ups in your browser or sign in with email

accessDenied.heading: Access Denied
accessDenied.reasonLeadUp: You do not have access to this page because
accessDenied.shouldHaveAccess: If you think you should have access to this page, please contact a site administrator or a member of the South Gate CEHAT.

manageAccount.methodFetchError: Error occurred when fetching user sign in methods
manageAccount.heading: Manage Your Account

notAdmin: you are not an admin user

users.name: Name

makeAdmin.confirmStart: Are you sure you want to make

removeAdmin.confirmStart: Are you sure you want to remove
removeAdmin.cannotBeUndone: This change cannot be undone without another administrator
removeAdmin.lastAdmin: Warning! You must make another user an admin user to be able to remove your own admin status.

users.changeAdminError: Unable to change admin status for

sensors.heading: Current Sensors
sensors.name: Sensor Name
sensors.lastValidAqiTimeNote: The time of the last valid AQI time refers to the last time that a sensor had enough good data to calculate an AQI. PurpleAir sensors have two sensors called channel A and channel B, and if the two channels readings are too different over a period of 24 hours, then we don't use the sensor reading from that time.
sensors.lastReadingTimeNote: The time of the most recent sensor reading is the last time that this website received a new sensor reading from PurpleAir. If the sensor is active and the time is old, this may mean that the sensor is no longer sending new readings.
sensors.confirmActivate: Confirm you want to activate the sensor
sensors.activateNote: Please note that this sensor's AQI will not show up on the map for at least 2 hours until enough data is collected to calculate the AQI for this sensor.
sensors.activeNote: Active denotes whether this website is collecting data for and displaying a sensor. This does not reflect any changes on the PurpleAir site.
sensors.changeActiveSensorError: Unable to change active status for sensor
sensors.confirmDeactivate: Confirm that you want to deactivate the sensor
sensors.deactivateNote: Please note that this sensor may take up to 10 minutes to be removed from the website's map. Deactivating the sensor will not delete any historical sensor data, but it will stop collecting new sensor data. This will also not make changes on PurpleAir's website.
sensors.addHelpPurpleAirId: To find the PurpleAir ID, go to the PurpleAir map, and click on the sensor you want to add. On the popup for the sensor, hover over 'Get This Widget', which is at the bottom. This will show text like this: '<div id='PurpleAirWidget_39165_module_...'. The PurpleAir ID is the number after the PurpleAirWidget, so in this case, the PurpleAir ID is 39165.
sensors.sensorAlreadyExists: A sensor with this PurpleAir ID already exists.
sensors.unableToAddSensor: Unable to add sensor. Please check that the PurpleAir ID is correct.
sensors.addSensorFailure: Unable to add sensor. Please try again later.

body.paragraph1: As time goes on, this system accumulates historical readings so that the team can use this data to analyze. However, the cost of storing this data in the database compounds and may exceed the budget of the organization. For this reason, from time to time, you may wish to migrate this data to a cheaper storage location.
body.paragraph2: First, you should download the data using the download data feature and store it somewhere safe, like a Google Drive or other file storage service. Then, you can delete the old data (data older than 7 days) from this panel. In order to delete data, you must first acknowledge the following conditions:

conditions.downloaded: I have downloaded the old data using the download data feature and verified it looks correct.
conditions.uploaded: I have uploaded the downloaded data to a safe file storage location.
conditions.irreversible: I understand this process is irreversible and the deleted data cannot be recovered from this system.

error.startBeforeEnd: Start date must be before end date
error.emptyField: At least one field is empty

downloadData.fetching: Fetching data, this may take a while
downloadData.whenReady: The data is ready for download!
downloadData.startHelper: If the start date is earlier than the first entry, the data will start at the first entry.
downloadData.endHelper: If the end date is later than the last entry, gets data until the last entry.
downloadData.whichSensor: Which sensor would you like to download data for?

deleteSensor.confirmDownload: I have downloaded any data I need.
deleteSensor.acknowledgeDelete: I acknowledge that this action will delete any historical data for this sensor.
deleteSensor.cannotBeUndone: I acknowledge that this action cannot be undone
deleteSensor.deleteNote: Deleting a sensor will remove it from the map and delete all of its data. You will need to re-add the sensor to show this sensor on the map again and to collect this sensor's data. If you only want to temporarily stop showing this sensor or collecting data for this sensor, deactivate the sensor instead.
deleteSensor.confirmPurpleAirId: Type the PurpleAir ID of the sensor to confirm deletion
deleteSensor.whichSensorToDelete: Which sensor would you like to delete?
